title: The Block's Mitch and Mark buy four bedroom home in Sydney for $1.7million
text:
Advertisement

The Block's Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie have spent close $1.7million on a four-bedroom home on Sydney's Northern Beaches.

The couple will renovate the 1970s-built property and sell it, Realestate.com.au reported on Thursday.

Known for their bold sense of interior design, the couple are set reconfigure the layout of the three-storey home to make the most of the stunning views of Newport Beach.

Ready to work their magic! The Block's stylish grandads Mitch and Mark have bought a four-bedroom property on Sydney's Northern Beach for $1.7million

Upon entry, the home opens up to a spacious living room and a large balcony with ocean views, perfect for outdoor entertaining.

On the same floor is the dining room and kitchen. While the fittings may appear dated, Mitch and Mark can easily remodel the space thanks to their 15 years of experience flipping properties in Sydney's inner-east.

The middle level features three spacious bedrooms, each with their own built-in wardrobes.

House flippers: The couple, known on The Block for their bold sense of interior design, will renovate the 1970s-built property and sell it

The basement floor has a self-contained living area complete with its own kitchen, as well as a fourth bedroom with an ensuite and a deck.

Real estate agent Gordon Archibald, from Wiseberry Mona Vale, said the property flippers fell in love with the panoramic view of the beach and hope to revamp the home with modern touches.

'They want to do a contemporary design that makes the most of the views, they want to take the house to the next level,' he said.

Stunning panorama: The three-storey home boasts spectacular views of nearby Newport Beach

Mr Archibald added: 'They were very definite in what they want and they were determined to buy it.'

Mitch and Mark, who are the oldest contestants on The Block, have not been afraid to ruffle feathers when it comes to their renovation of the Oslo Hotel in St Kilda.

They recently went head-to-head with Tess and Luke after they voted against the installation of a luxury pool.

Revamping the property: Real estate agent Gordon Archibald, from Wiseberry Mona Vale, said property flippers fell in love with the panoramic view of the beach and hope to revamp the home with modern touches

In retaliation, the 'stylish grandads' told their hired tradesmen they were banned from helping out the struggling couple.

Mitch furiously declared: 'You f**k with us, I will f**k with you!'

Mark added: 'They have just f**ked us over, so we are going to f**king win this thing.'

authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
